question: It is now seven-oh-six. You have exactly eight hours and fifty-four minutes to think about why you're here. To ponder the error of your ways... ...and you may not talk. You will not move from these seats. ...and you... ...will not sleep. Alright people, we're gonna try something a little different today. We are going to write an essay--of no less than a thousand words--describing to me who you think you are.
And when I say essay...I mean essay. I do not mean a single word repeated a thousand times. Is that clear Mr. Bender?
Good. Maybe you'll learn a little something about yourself. Maybe you'll even--decide whether or not you care to return.
answer: You know, I can answer that right now sir...That'd be "No", no for me. 'cause...

question: Sit down Johnson...
I can't believe this is really happening to me...
answer: Oh, shit! What're we s'posed to do if we hafta take a piss?

question: Please...
answer: If you gotta go... You gotta go!

question: Hey, yer not urinating in here man!
answer: Don't talk! Don't talk! It makes it crawl back up!

question: You whip it out and you're dead before the first drop hits the floor!
answer: You're pretty sexy when you get angry...grrr! Hey, homeboy... ...why don't you go close that door. We'll get the prom queen-- impregnated!

question: Hey! Hey!
If I lose my temper, you're totalled man!
I'm hurt.
answer: You know why guys like you knock everything...

question: Oh, this should be stunning...
Oh, God! You ritchies are so smart, that's exactly why I'm not heavy in activities!
Hey...Cherry...do you belong to the physics club?
So?
answer: So...academic clubs aren't the same as other kinds of clubs.

question: Oh, but to dorks like him... ...they are. What do you guys do in your club?
answer: In physics, um, we ah, we talk about physics...about properties of physics.

question: So it's sorta social...demented and sad, but social. Right?
answer: Yeah, well, I guess you could consider it a social situation. I mean there are other children in my club and uh, at the end of the year we have, um, you know, a big banquet, at the, uh, at the Hilton.

question: You load up, you party...
answer: Well, no, we get dressed up...I mean, but, we don't...we don't get high.

question: Look, you guys keep up your talking and Vernon's gonna come right in here...I got a meet this Saturday and I'm not gonna miss it on account of you boneheads...
answer: Oh and wouldn't that be a bite... Missing a whole wrestling meet!

question: Well you wouldn't know anything about it, faggot! You never competed in your whole life!
answer: Oh, I know...I feel all empty inside because of it. I have such a deep admiration for guys that roll around on the floor with other guys!

question: Ahhh...you'd never miss it. You don't have any goals.
Yeah?
answer: I wanna be just--like--you! I figure all I need's a labotamy and some tights!

question: You wear tights?
answer: No I don't wear tights, I wear the required uniform...

question: Tights...
Am I a genius?
What a funny guy!
Everyone just shhh! CUT TO: I've been here before, I know what I'm doing!
answer: No! Fix the door, get up there and fix it!

question: Who?
Give me that screw...
You want me to yank you outta that seat and shake it out of you?
answer: I don't have it...screws fall out all of the time, the world's an imperfect place...

question: Watch it, young lady...
answer: The door's way too heavy, sir.

question: God damnit! Andrew Clark...get up here. Come on, front and center, let's go.
answer: Hey, how come Andrew gets to get up? If he gets up, we'll all get up, it'll be anarchy!

question: Okay, now, watch the magazines!
answer: It's out of my hands... That's very clever sir, but what if there's a fire? I think violating fire codes and endangering the lives of children would be unwise at this juncture in your career, sir.

question: Show Dick some respect!
answer: Let's go...go! Get back into your seat. I expected a little more from a varsity letterman! You're not fooling anybody, Bender! The next screw that falls out is gonna be you!

question: Eat my shorts...
Eat my shorts!
answer: You just bought yourself another Saturday, mister!

question: Oh, Christ...
answer: You just bought one more right there!

question: Well, I'm free the Saturday after that...beyond that, I'm gonna have to check my calendar!
answer: Good! 'Cause it's gonna be filled, we'll keep goin'! You want another one? Say the word, just say the word! Instead of going to prison, you'll come here! Are you through.

question: No!
So?
answer: That's another one, right now! I've got you for the rest of your natural born life if you don't watch your step! You want another one?

question: Yes!
answer: You got it! You got another one, right there! That's another one pal!

question: You through?
Good! You got one more, right there!
answer: Do you really think I give a shit?

question: Another... You through?
Shut up, Peewee! You're mine Bender...for two months I gotcha! I gotcha!
answer: What can I say? I'm thrilled!

question: Oh, I'm sure that's exactly what you want these people to believe. You know something, Bender? You ought to spend a little more time trying to do something with yourself and a little less time trying to impress people. You might be better off. Alright, that's it! I'm going to be right outside those doors. The next time I hafta come in here...I'm cracking skulls!
Hey, you grounded tonight?
answer: I don't know, my mom said I was but by dad told me to just blow her off.

question: Big party at Stubbies, parents are in Europe. Should be pretty wild...
Yeah, can you go?
How come?
answer: Well 'cause if I do what my mother tells me not to do, it's because because my father says it's okay. There's like this whole big monster deal, it's endless and it's a total drag. It's like any minute... divorce...

question: Well 'cause if I do what my mother tells me not to do, it's because because my father says it's okay. There's like this whole big monster deal, it's endless and it's a total drag. It's like any minute... divorce...
What?
answer: You like your old man better than your mom?

question: They're both strict.
answer: No, I mean, if you had to choose between them.

question: Aw...you're breaking my heart...
What?
answer: You get along with your parents?

question: Well if I say yes, I'm an idiot, right?
answer: You're an idiot anyway...But if you say you get along with your parents well you're a liar too!

question: You know something, man...If we weren't in school right now, I'd waste you!
answer: Can you hear this? Want me to turn it up?

question: Can you hear this? Want me to turn it up?
answer: Hey fellas, I mean... ...I don't like my parents either, I don't...I don't get along with them...their idea of parental compassion is just, you know, wacko!

question: Dork...
You are a parent's wet dream, okay?

Look, I can see you getting all bunged up for them making you wear these kinda clothes. But face it, you're a Neo-Maxi-Zoom-Dweebie! What would you be doing if you weren't out making yourself a better citizen?
answer: Why do you have to insult everybody?

question: I'm being honest, asshole! I would expect you...to know the difference!
Yeah?
My condolences...
What's yours?
Ka-Laire?
Nooo...It's a fat girl's name!
You're welcome...

Well not at present but I could see you really pushing maximum density! You see, I'm not sure if you know this...but there are two kinds of fat people. There's fat people that were born to be fat, and then there's fat people that were once thin but they became fat...so when you look at them you can sorta see that thin person inside! You see, you're gonna get married, you're gonna squeeze out a few puppies and then, uh... Oh...obscene finger gestures from such a pristine girl!
Are you a virgin? I'll bet you a million dollars that you are! Let's end the suspense! Is it gonna be... ...a white weddin?
answer: Why don't you just shut up?

question: Have you ever kissed a boy on the mouth? Have you ever been felt up? Over the bra, under the blouse, shoes off...hoping to God your parents don't walk in?
answer: Do you want me to puke?

question: Over the panties, no bra, blouse unbuttoned, Calvin's in a ball on the front seat past eleven on a school night?
answer: Leave her alone! I said leave her alone!

question: You gonna make me?
You and how many of your friends?
answer: Just me, just you and me. Two hits. Me hitting you, you hitting the floor! Anytime you're ready, pal!

question: I don't wanna get into to this with you man...
'Cause I'd kill you...It's real simple. I'd kill you and your fucking parents would sue me and it would be a big mess and I don't care enough about you to bother.
answer: Chicken shit... Let's end this right now. You don't talk to her...you don't look at her and you don't even think about her! You understand me?

question: I'm trying to help her!.
Your dad works here? Uh, Carl?
Can I ask you a question?
How does one become a janitor?
No I just wanna know how one becomes a janitor because Andrew here, is very interested in persuing a career in the custodial arts...
answer: Oh, really? You guys think I'm just some untouchable peasant? Peon? Huh? Maybe so, but following a broom around after shitheads like you for the past eight years I've learned a couple of things...I look through your letters, I look through your lockers...I listen to your conversations, you don't know that but I do...I am the eyes and ears of this institution my friends. By the way, that clock's twenty minutes fast!

question: Shit! CUT TO:
answer: Allright girls, that's thirty minutes for lunch...

question: Here?
Well I think the cafeteria would be a more suitable place for us to eat lunch in, sir!
answer: Well, I don't care what you think, Andrew!

question: So, what's your poison? What do you drink? Okay...forget I asked...
Vodka? When do you drink vodka?
A lot?
Is that why you're here today? Why are you here?

Um, I'm here today...because uh, because my coach and my father don't want me to blow my ride. See I get treated differently because uh, Coach thinks I'm a winner. So does my old man. I'm not a winner because I wanna be one... I'm a winner because I got strength and speed. Kinda like a race horse. That's about how involved I am in what's happening to me.
answer: Yeah? That's very interesting. Now why don't you tell me why you're really in here.

question: Claire...you wanna see a picture of a guy with elephantitus of the nuts? It's pretty tasty...
How do you think he rides a bike? Oh, Claire...would you ever consider dating a guy like this?
answer: Can't you just leave me alone?

question: I mean if he had a great personality and was a good dancer and had a cool car...Although you'd probably have to ride in the back seat 'cause his nuts would ride shotgun.
answer: You know what I wish I was doing?

question: I'm not a cherry.
answer: When have you ever gotten laid?

question: I've laid, lotsa times!
She lives in Canada, met her at Niagra Falls. You wouldn't know her.
He is lying!
answer: Oh you weren't motioning to Claire?

question: You know he's lying, right?
answer: Were you or were you not motioning to Claire?

question: What's in there?
You're wearing it...
What's that?
Sushi?
answer: Rice, uh, raw fish and seaweed.

question: You won't accept a guys tongue in your mouth and you're gonna eat that?
What're we having?
answer: Uh, it's your standard, regular lunch I guess...

question: Milk?
I can read! PB & J with the crusts cut off...Well Brian, this is a very nutritous lunch, all the food groups are represented. Did your mom marry Mr. Rogers?

Ahhh.... Here's my impression of life at big Bri's house... Son! Yeah Dad? How's your day, pal? Great Dad, how's yours? Super, say son, how'd you like to go fishing this weekend? Great Dad, but I've got homework to do! That's alright son, you can do it, on the boat! Geee!!! Dear, isn't our son swell? Yes Dear, isn't life swell?
Oh, mine?
You wanna come over sometime?
answer: That's bullshit. It's all part of your image, I don't believe a word of it.

question: You don't believe me?
No?
What's the point in going to Bender's locker?
This is so stupid...Why do you think, why are we risking getting caught?
So then what are we doing?
answer: You ask me one more question and I'm beating the shit out of you!

question: Sorry...
Drugs...
Drugs...the boy had marijuana. That was marijuana!
Wait! Wait, hold it! Hold it! We have to go through the cafeteria!
Hey man, you don't know what you're talking about!
answer: No you don't know what you're talking about! Now we're through listening to you, we're going this way. Shit!

question: Great idea Jagoff!
Get back to the library, keep your unit on this!
Three...two...one!
answer: Bender! Bender! Bender! What is this? What are you doing here, what is this?

question: Oh, hi!
answer: Out! That's it Bender! Out, it's over!

question: Don't you wanna hear my excuse?
I'm thinking of trying out for a scholarship.
answer: Gimmie the ball, Bender. Get your stuff, let's go! Mr. Wiseguy here has taken it upon himself to go to the gymnasium. I'm sorry to inform you, you're going to be without his services for the rest of the day.

question: B-O-O H-O-O!
answer: Everything's a big joke, huh Bender? The false alarm you pulled, Friday, false alarms are really funny, aren't they...What if your home, what if your family... ...what if your dope was on fire?

question: Impossible, sir...It's in Johnson's underwear...
answer: You think he's funny? You think this is cute? You think he's bitchin', is that it? Lemme tell you something. Look at him, he's a bum. You wanna see something funny? You go visit John Bender in five years! You'll see how God damned funny he is! What's the matter, John? You gonna cry? Let's go...

question: Hey keep your fuckin' hands off me! I expect better manners from you, Dick! For better hallway vision!
answer: That's the last time, Bender. That's the last time you ever make me look bad in front of those kids, do you hear me? I make $31,000 dollars a year and I have a home and I'm not about to throw it away on some punk like you...But someday, man, someday. When you're outta here and you've forgotten all about this place... And they've forgotten all about you and you're wrapped up in your own pathetic life...I'm gonna be there. That's right. And I'm gonna kick the living shit out of you, man, I'm gonna knock your dick in the dirt!

question: Are you threatening me?
answer: What're you gonna do about it? You think anybody's gonna believe you? You think anybody's gonna take your word over mine? I'm a man of respect around here. They love me around here, I'm a swell guy...you're a lying sack of shit! And everybody knows it. Oh, you're a real tough guy...come on, come on...get on your feet, pal! Let's find out how tough you are! I wanna know right now, how tough you are! Come on! I'll give you the first punch, let's go! Come on, right here, just take the first shot! Please, I'm begging you, take a shot! Come on, just take one shot, that's all I need, just one swing... That's what I though...you're a gutless turd!

question: A naked blond walks into a bar, with a poodle under one arm and a two foot salami under the other. She lays the poodle on the table. Bar- tender says Oh shit!!!! CUT TO:
I forgot my pencil...
answer: God damnit! What in God's name is going on in here? What was that ruckus?

question: Mister, oh mister Tearney...a history of slight mental illness? Wooh, no wonder he's so fucked up!
Hey Carl, how you doin'?
Good, what's up?
answer: Not much, what's happening, what are you doing in the basement files?

Yeah...

question: Well, well what would you like?
What?
No...
answer: Well would you mind telling me how you know all this about me?

question: I stole your wallet...
No...
answer: Give it! This is great...you're a thief too! Huh?

question: I'm not a thief!
Are all these your girlfriends?
What about the others?

question: Consider what?
answer: Whether or not, I wanna hang out with them...

question: You don't believe in just one guy, one girl?
Yeah...that's the way it should be.
Why not?
answer: How come you got so much shit in your purse?

question: How come you got so many girlfriends?
I dunno...I guess I never throw anything away.
Do you always carry this much shit in your bag?
answer: Yeah...I always carry this much shit ...in my bag...You never know when you may have to jam...

question: Are you gonna be like a shopping bag lady? You know like, sit in alleyways and like talk to buildings and wear men's shoes and that kinda thing?
answer: I'll do what I have to do...

question: Why do you have to do anything?
So you're saying you'd subject yourself to the violent dangers of the Chicago streets because your homelife is unsatisfying?
answer: I don't have to run away and live in the street...I can run away and, go to the ocean, I can go to the country, I can go to the mountains. I can go to Israel, Africa, Afghanistan...

question: Nevermind...forget it, everything's cool!
No! There's no deal, Sporto. Forget it, leave me alone.
answer: Wait a minute, now you're carrying all that crap around in your purse. Either you really wanna run away or you want people to think you wanna run away.

question: Hi, you wanna talk?
Why not?
Where do you want me to go?
Oh, I have problems?
answer: You do everything everybody ever tells you to do, that is a problem!

question: Okay, fine...but I didn't dump my purse out on the couch and invite people into my problems...Did I? So what's wrong? What is it? Is is bad? Real bad? Parents?
What do they do to you?
What did you want to be when you were young?
answer: When I was a kid, I wanted to be John Lennon...

question: Carl don't be a goof! I'm trying to make a serious point here...I've been teaching, for twenty two years, and each year...these kids get more and more arrogant.
answer: Aw bull shit, man. Come on Vern, the kids haven't changed, you have! You took a teaching position, 'cause you thought it'd be fun, right? Thought you could have summer vacations off...and then you found out it was actually work...and that really bummed you out.

question: These kids turned on me...they think I'm a big fuckin' joke...
answer: Come on...listen Vern, if you were sixteen, what would you think of you, huh?

question: Hey...Carl, you think I give one rat's ass what these kids think of me?
You think about this...when you get old, these kids; when I get old, they're gonna be runnin' the country.
Now this is the thought that wakes me up in the middle of the night... That when I get older, these kids are gonna take care of me...
What would I do for a million bucks? Well, I guess I'd do as little as I had to...
Well, how'm I s'posed to answer?
answer: The idea is to like search your mind for the absolute limit. Like, uh, would you drive to school naked?

question: Um, uh...would I have to get out of the car?
In the spring, or winter?
In front of the school or in back of the school?
He nailed me...
I don't think that from a legal standpoint what he did can be construed as rape since I paid him.
Yeah...he's married too!
answer: Do you have any idea how completely gross that is?

question: Well, the first few times...
answer: First few times? You mean he did it more than once?

question: Sure...
Look, I'm not gonna discuss my private life with total strangers.
answer: It's kind of a double-edged sword, isn't it?

question: A what?
answer: Well, if you say you haven't... you're a prude. If you say you have...you're a slut! It's a trap. You want to but you can't but when you do you wish you didn't, right?

question: Wrong...
I don't do anything!
Okay, lemme ask you a few questions.
No! Doesn't it bother you to sleep around without being in love. I mean don't you want any respect?
answer: I don't screw to get respect...That's the difference between you and me...

question: Not the only difference, I hope.
I'm not a tease!
answer: Sure you are! You said it yourself sex is a weapon, you use it to get respect!

question: No, I never said that, she twisted my words around.
answer: Oh then what do you use it for?

question: I don't use it period!
answer: Oh, are you medically frigid or is it psychological?

question: I didn't mean it that way! You guys are putting words into my mouth!
answer: Well if you'd just answer the question...

question: No! I never did it!
answer: I never did it either, I'm not a nymphomaniac...I'm a compulsive liar...

question: You are such a bitch! You did that on purpose just to fuck me over!
answer: I would do it though...If you love someone it's okay...

question: I can't believe you, you're so weird. You don't say anything all day and then when you open your mouth...you unload all these tremendous lies all over me!
answer: You're just pissed off because she got you to admit something you didn't want to admit to...

question: Okay, fine, but that doesn't make it any less bizarre...
answer: What's bizarre? I mean we're all pretty bizarre! Some of us are just better at hiding it, that's all.

question: She's right...do you guys know what, uh, what I did to get in here? I taped Larry Lester's buns together.
Yeah, you know him?

'Cause I'm stupid...'cause I'm failing shop. See we had this assignment, to make this ceramic elephant, and um...and we had eight weeks to do it and we're s'posed ta, and it was like a lamp, and when you pull the trunk the light was s'posed to go on...my light didn't go on, I got a F on it. Never got a F in my life... When I signed up, you know, for the course I mean. I thought I was playing it real smart, you know. 'Cause I thought, I'll take shop, it'll be such an easy way to maintain my grade point average...
answer: Why'd you think it'd be easy?

question: Have you seen some of the dopes that take shop?
answer: I take shop...you must be a fuckin' idiot!

question: I'm a fuckin' idiot because I can't make a lamp?
answer: No, you're a genius because you can't make a lamp...

question: What do you know about Trigonometry?
answer: I could care less about Trigonometry...

question: Bender, did you know without Trigonometry there'd be no engineering?
answer: Without lamps, there'd be no light!

question: I wanna see what Claire can do!
Now, everybody can do something...
answer: There's one thing I can do, no forget it, it's way too embarrassing.

question: You ever seen Wild Kingdom? I mean that guy's been doing that show for thirty years.
answer: Okay, but you have to swear to God you won't laugh...I can't believe I'm actually doing this...

question: What do you care what I think, anyway? I don't even count, right? I could disappear forever and it wouldn't make any difference...I may as well not even exist at this school, remember? And you...don't like me anyway!
answer: You know, I have just as many feelings as you do and it hurts just as much when somebody steps all over them!

question: God, you're so pathetic! Don't you ever...ever! Compare yourself to me! Okay? You got everything, and I got shit! Fuckin' Rapunzel, right? School would probably fucking shut down if you didn't show up! "Queenie isn't here!" I like those earrings Claire.
Are those real diamonds, Claire?
Or did your daddy buy those?
So, so on Monday...what happens?
answer: Are we still friends, you mean? If we're friends now, that is?

question: Yeah...
Yeah, I want the truth...
Same exact thing!
Why? 'Cause I'm telling the truth, that makes me a bitch?
answer: No! 'Cause you know how shitty that is to do to someone! And you don't got the balls to stand up to your friends and tell 'em that you're gonna like who you wanna like!

question: Okay, what about you, you hypocrite! Why don't you take Allison to one of your heavy metal vomit parties? Or take Brian out to the parking lot at lunch to get high? What about Andy for that matter, what about me? What would your friends say if we were walking down the hall together. They'd laugh their asses off and you'd probably tell them you were doing it with me so they'd forgive you for being seen with me.
answer: Don't you ever talk about my friends! You don't know any of my friends, you don't look at any of my friends and you certainly wouldn't condescend to speak to any of my friends so you just stick to the things you know, shopping, nail polish, your father's BMW and your poor--rich--drunk mother in the Carribean!

question: Shut up!
answer: And as far as being concerned about what's gonna happen when you and I walk down the hallways at school, you can forget it! 'Cause it's never gonna happen! Just bury your head in the sand...and wait for your fuckin' prom!

question: I hate you!
Then I assume Allison and I are better people than you guys, huh? Us weirdos... Do you, would you do that to me?
Well if you did?
answer: No...I don't think the kind of friends I'd have would mind...

question: I just wanna tell, each of you, that I wouldn't do that...I wouldn't and I will not! 'Cause I think that's real shitty...
answer: Your friends wouldn't mind because they look up to us...

question: You're so conceited, Claire. You're so conceited. You're so, like, full of yourself, why are you like that?
answer: I'm not saying that to be conceited! I hate it! I hate having to go along with everything my friends say!

question: Well then why do you do it?
answer: I don't know, I don't...you don't understand..you don't. You're not friends with the same kind of people that Andy and I are friends with! You know, you just don't understand the pressure that they can put on you!

question: I don't understand what? You think I don't understand pressure, Claire? Well fuck you! Fuck you! Know why I'm here today? Do you? I'm here because Mr. Ryan found a gun in the locker...
answer: Why'd you have a gun in your locker?

question: I tried. You pull the fuckin' trunk on it and the light's s'posed to go on...and it didn't go on, I mean,
Just forget it...
I can't have an F, I can't have it and I know my parents can't have it! Even if I aced the rest of the semester, I'm still only a B. And everything's ruined for me!
So I considered my options, you know?
answer: No! Killing yourself is not an option!

question: Brian?
Are you gonna write your paper?
Well, it's kinda a waste for all of us to write our paper, don't you think?
answer: Oh, but that's what Vernon wants us to do...

question: True, but I think we'd all kinda say the same thing.
answer: You just don't want to write your paper...Right?

question: True, but, you're the smartest, right?
Great... Come on...
Come on! Don't be afraid.
answer: Don't stick that in my eye!

question: I'm not sticking it, just close... just go like that... Good... You know you really do look a lot better without all that black shit on your eyes...
This looks a lot better...look up.
answer: Please, why're you being so nice to me?

question: Why'd you do that?
You know how you said before, how your parents used you to get back at each other...wouldn't I be outstanding in that capacity?
answer: Were you really disgusted about what I did with my lipstick?

question: Truth?
What happened to you?
answer: Why? Claire did it! What's wrong?

question: Nothing's wrong, it's just so different. I can see your face.
